The statement "Either the pen is in my bag or it is on my desk" is a disjunction that is true if at least one of the simple statements is true.

The second statement given is "The pen isn't on my desk", which negates the second simple statement in the disjunction. If the second simple statement is false, then the truth of the disjunction depends on the first simple statement.

Therefore, if we know that the pen is not on the desk, then it must be in the bag, assuming that the disjunction "Either the pen is in my bag or it is on my desk" is true.
